dialogs.line: This armor is fine-crafted, worthy of any warrior. It will shield you from harm, friend.
Hold on, friend. Is armor truly what you need? Protecting yourself may seem wise, but there’s strength in vulnerability as well.
Strength? Vulnerability leaves you exposed. Armor allows you to face your enemies without fear.
Perhaps, but walls keep out more than just harm. When you shield yourself, you distance yourself from those who would support you. To truly thrive, we must let others in.
Yet who would rely on a warrior who falls easily? Protection lets you fight another day, to stand strong beside your allies.
But if we always hide behind armor, our allies may never know us, never truly understand our struggles. Connection requires openness, not barriers.

dialogs.question: So, what will you do? Will you accept the armor for protection or trust in your strength and openness with others?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor. Safety is worth it.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll go without. My strength lies in my trust in others.

dialogs.line: A wise choice, friend. May this armor protect you well in the trials to come.
I only hope that your armor doesn’t keep others at a distance. True strength isn’t always found behind steel.
A bold decision. I hope your allies are as reliable as you believe.
Thank you, Merchant. I believe that through trust and connection, I will find the strength to face whatever awaits.
